 2.4 - NAVIGABLE
LOCATION(LEVEL AAA)
On accessible websites...

Information about the user's location within a set of Web pages is available. 

These websites...

Provide ways to help users navigate, find content, and determine where they are.

WHAT'S AN EXAMPLE?
 Links to help user determine their location in a site 

A research group is part of an educational department at a university. The
group's home page links to the department home page and the university's home
page. 

I still don't really understand
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG22/Understanding/location.html#examples]

Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.2, W3C World Wide Web Consortium
Recommendation 21 May 2021 (https://www.w3.org/TR/2021/WD-WCAG22-20210521/,
Latest version at https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/)
